title: I made an oath to not listen to music ever again intentionally realized that I shouldn’t have made this oath because music is everywhere. What should I do keep my oath or break it and just not listen to music intentionally (Islam)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Listen, you are a human being. You can make mistakes while giving oaths to your God. Of course, it hurts. You had your reasons for never listening to music, but as you said, music is everywhere. In your religion modern American music is prohibited because it has bad lyrics about sex. Yet there is Russian pop music with deep philosophical lyrics about life and there is Chinese pop music where the subject of suffering and the limitations of being human is brought up. How is avoiding this kind of music good? Sometimes vows are meant to be broken if they make no sense.

No religion is worth giving up music for. Truly. Music gives joy and pleasure and wonder and solace and worship and contemplation of the divine to billions of people. What in the world are you trying to do to yourself? Truly? This makes me very, very sad for you. If there’s a heaven, it has music in it. If you want to split hairs, “listening” is intentional while “hearing” is unintentional. But while you can stop listening to God, you can’t stop hearing God. Same with music. Let yourself off the hook, do. Stop taking yourself so very seriously.
